intro: Machaeranthera tanacetifolia var. pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf tansy, is a compact perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense, flat-topped clusters. The plant is characterized by its aromatic foliage, which emits a strong, camphor-like scent. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
